Description: Acupuncture is an ancient healing practice that involves inserting thin needles into specific points on the body to stimulate healing and restore balance. In veterinary medicine, acupuncture is used to treat a wide range of conditions and can be particularly effective for pain management, neurological issues, and chronic diseases.
Related Conditions: Pain management, arthritis, hip dysplasia, intervertebral disc disease, allergies, digestive disorders, anxiety

Description: Veterinary chiropractic care focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of mechanical disorders of the musculoskeletal system, especially the spine. Adjustments help restore proper alignment and movement, which can improve nerve function and overall health.
Related Conditions: Back pain, neck pain, limping, muscle spasms, post-surgical recovery, athletic injuries, mobility issues

Description: Herbal medicine uses plants and plant extracts to treat illness and promote health. Veterinary herbalists may use Western herbs, Chinese herbs, or Ayurvedic herbs depending on their training and the patient's needs.
Related Conditions: Digestive issues, skin conditions, immune support, liver disease, kidney disease, cancer support, anxiety

Description: Homeopathy is a system of alternative medicine based on the principle of 'like cures like.' Practitioners use highly diluted substances to trigger the body's natural healing responses.
Related Conditions: Chronic diseases, behavioral issues, allergies, skin conditions, digestive disorders, fear and anxiety

Description: Nutritional therapy focuses on using diet and supplements to prevent and treat disease. A veterinary nutritionist can create customized diet plans to address specific health conditions.
Related Conditions: Obesity, diabetes, kidney disease, food allergies, inflammatory bowel disease, cancer support, skin conditions

Description: TCVM is a comprehensive medical system that includes acupuncture, herbal medicine, food therapy, and Tui-na (medical massage). It's based on ancient Chinese philosophy and focuses on restoring balance and harmony in the body.
Related Conditions: Chronic pain, digestive disorders, respiratory issues, neurological conditions, immune disorders, geriatric care

Description: Veterinary physical therapy and rehabilitation uses techniques like therapeutic exercise, hydrotherapy, massage, and electrical stimulation to help animals recover from injury, surgery, or manage chronic conditions.
Related Conditions: Post-surgical recovery, arthritis, neurological conditions, obesity, sports injuries, geriatric mobility

Description: Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) or cold laser therapy uses specific wavelengths of light to stimulate healing at the cellular level. It's non-invasive and can help reduce pain and inflammation.
Related Conditions: Wound healing, arthritis, post-surgical recovery, skin conditions, ear infections, dental disease
